author.name: Tangent Notes
author.description: A markdown note writing app that helps you explore your mind. Never get lost. Follow Your Tangent.\n\nSupport on Patreon: https://t.co/a17qHxrBbo

html: Tangent 0.4.0-alpha.10 is out!\n\nThis update lets you name & save queries to the workspace, adds new icons to the sidebar, and more! https://t.co/X9T2xLk1Xx

author.name: ClickUp
author.description: Save time with the all-in-one productivity platform that brings teams, tasks, and tools together in one place.

html: Let's talk productivity and systems and how to 3x your performance. \n\nIt's going to be fun 🤝 https://t.co/MsRl6koT0H

Do you know if the follow button works on Twitter these days?

Give it a try and I'll tell you.

And then I will tell you about how you can make systems explainable, the single largest challenge in software development today.

author.name: Jack
author.description: Research in data visualization, embeddings and knowledge graphs. Linguist, ontologist and information scientist. Data labeling. Hieroglyphs.

author.name: CPU Duke
author.description: CPU collector and enthusiast, vintage microelectronics, x86 and more. Please visit also my YouTube channel for more…

html: In the mid 90s, I started #collecting #CPUs and crafted my own wooden case to sort and display them. Over time, I needed a second and larger one. Today, I have more than 1000 #microprocessors and I hence started a new project to manage this new era. Stay tuned for the result! https://t.co/pi3ZWnqhD0

author.name: Cortex Futura
author.description: Teaching Tana and how to make Knowledge Management actionable for individuals and teams

html:
5 Tana Feature You Might Have Missed! (New Video)

1) PARENT and GRANDPARENT in Live Search
2) Auto-init source tag from ancestor
3) Build title from fields
4) Multi-Tag Nodes
5) Multiple Inheritance

🧵

author.name: TfT Hacker - Exploring Tools for Thought and PKM

html:
5 Tana Feature You Might Have Missed! (New Video)

author.name: TfT Hacker - Exploring Tools for Thought and PKM
author.description: Exploring Tools for Thought space and PKM, with focus on tools like Obsidian, Tana, Craft, LogSeq, RemNote, AthensResearch, OneNote, etc https://t.co/GyMiAikIl1

html:
Tana in the real world

In this interview, @RobertHaisfield interviews a college student who is using Tana for over a year & we see some cool usage. One technique she uses is a live query from her notes during lectures to create a questions list. #TfT

https://t.co/i63gHsjWmx

author.name: Winston
author.description: Doctor | Zen | PKM | SG 🇸🇬\nObsidian/Tana stack\nFinding clarity in chaos 🧘🏻‍♂️🌪️

html: Just had a wild thought, but what if - instead of "individual" captures, what if we could literally capture websites/articles/videos into a global database, making Tana an "internet" of its own... ok i'll stop here haha
